alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:51AM EST until January 10 at 7:31PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Brandywine Creek At Wilmington affecting New Castle County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Wilmington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek at Wilmington. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Minor flooding begins along the creek in the Brandywine State Park. At 16.5 feet, North Park Drive, west of North Market Street, in Brandywine State Park is subject to flooding and closures. At 17.0 feet, Some flooding begins in the historic Breck`s Mill area in Montchanin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 16.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.7 feet on 10/30/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Wilmington 16.5 16.1 Wed 5 am 13.9 13.0 16.7 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EST.
